what: Seasonal Adjustment with TRAMO-SEATS and JDemetra+ 3.0
title: Seasonal Adjustment with TRAMO-SEATS and JDemetra+ 3.0
text: rjd3tramoseats offers full acces options outputs TRAMO-SEATS (rjd3tramoseats::tramoseats()), including TRAMO modelling (rjd3tramoseats::tramo()) SEATS decomposition (rjd3tramoseats::seats_decompose()). specification can created functions rjd3tramoseats::tramo_spec() rjd3tramoseats::tramoseats_spec() can modified function: pre-processing: rjd3toolkit::set_arima(), rjd3toolkit::set_automodel(), rjd3toolkit::set_basic(), rjd3toolkit::set_easter(), rjd3toolkit::set_estimate(), rjd3toolkit::set_outlier(), rjd3toolkit::set_tradingdays(), rjd3toolkit::set_transform(), rjd3toolkit::add_outlier(), rjd3toolkit::remove_outlier(), rjd3toolkit::add_ramp(), rjd3toolkit::remove_ramp(), rjd3toolkit::add_usrdefvar(); decomposition: rjd3tramoseats::set_seats(); benchmarking: rjd3toolkit::set_benchmarking().

title: Seasonal Adjustment with TRAMO-SEATS and JDemetra+ 3.0

code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("rjdemetra/rjd3toolkit@*release") remotes::install_github("rjdemetra/rjd3tramoseats@*release") # Install development version from GitHub # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("rjdemetra/rjd3tramoseats")

what: Refresh a specification with constraints — refresh
title: Refresh a specification with constraints — refresh
text: Function allowing create new specification updating specification used previous estimation. selected parameters kept fixed (previous estimation results) others freed re-estimation domain constraints. See details examples.

title: Refresh a specification with constraints — refresh
code: tramo_refresh(   spec,   refspec = NULL,   policy = c("FreeParameters", "Complete", "Outliers_StochasticComponent", "Outliers",     "FixedParameters", "FixedAutoRegressiveParameters", "Fixed"),   period = 0,   start = NULL,   end = NULL )  tramoseats_refresh(   spec,   refspec = NULL,   policy = c("FreeParameters", "Complete", "Outliers_StochasticComponent", "Outliers",     "FixedParameters", "FixedAutoRegressiveParameters", "Fixed", "Current"),   period = 0,   start = NULL,   end = NULL )

title: Refresh a specification with constraints — refresh
text: spec current specification refreshed ("result_spec"). refspec reference specification used define domain considered re-estimation ("domain_spec"). default "TRfull" "RSAfull" specification. policy refresh policy apply (see details). period, start, end specify span outliers re-identified (.e.: re-detected) policy = "Outliers" policy = "Outliers_StochasticComponent". Span definition: period: numeric, number observations year (12, 4...). start end: first last date outliers re-identfied, defined arrays two elements: year first period (example, period = 12, c(1980, 1) January 1980). specified, outliers re-identified whole series.

title: Refresh a specification with constraints — refresh
text: new specification, object class "JD3_TRAMOSEATS_SPEC" "JD3_TRAMO_SPEC".

title: Refresh a specification with constraints — refresh
text: selection constraints kept fixed re-estimated called revision policy. User-defined parameters always copied new refreshed specifications. Tramo (reg-arima pre-adjustment part) refreshed, final ARIMA model handed SEATS decomposition part might changed result refreshing process. Available refresh policies : Current: applying current pre-adjustment reg-arima model adding new raw data points Additive Outliers (defined new intervention variables) Fixed: applying current pre-adjustment reg-arima model replacing forecasts new raw data points. FixedParameters: pre-adjustment reg-arima model partially modified: regression coefficients re-estimated regression variables, Arima orders coefficients unchanged. FixedAutoRegressiveParameters: FixedParameters Arima Moving Average coefficients (MA) also re-estimated, Auto-regressive (AR) coefficients kept fixed. using Seats decomposition avoids possible re-allocation roots trend seasonal components, might led strong revisions. FreeParameters: regression Arima model coefficients re-estimated, regression variables Arima orders kept fixed. Outliers: regression variables Arima orders kept fixed, outliers re-detected defined span, thus regression Arima model coefficients re-estimated Outliers_StochasticComponent: "Outliers" Arima model orders (p,d,q)(P,D,Q) can also re-identified.

title: Refresh a specification with constraints — refresh
text: information revision policies JDemetra+ online documentation: https://jdemetra-new-documentation.netlify.app/t-rev-policies-production

title: Refresh a specification with constraints — refresh
code: y<- rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.08.10.M # raw series for first estimation y_raw <-window(y,end = 2009) # raw series for second (refreshed) estimation y_new <-window(y,end = 2010) # specification for first estimation spec_ts_1<-tramoseats_spec("RSAFull") # first estimation sa_ts<- tramoseats(y_raw, spec_ts_1) # refreshing the specification current_result_spec <- sa_ts$result_spec current_domain_spec <- sa_ts$estimation_spec spec_ts_ref <- tramoseats_refresh(current_result_spec, # point spec to be refreshed   current_domain_spec, #domain spec (set of constraints)   policy = "FixedAutoRegressiveParameters") # 2nd estimation with refreshed specification sa_ts_ref <- tramoseats(y_new, spec_ts_ref)

title: SEATS Decomposition — seats_decompose
text: SEATS Decomposition

title: SEATS Decomposition — seats_decompose
code: seats_decompose(   sarima,   seas.tolerance = 2,   trend.boundary = 0.5,   seas.boundary = 0.8,   seas.boundary.unique = 0.8,   approximation = c("None", "Legacy", "Noisy") )

title: SEATS Decomposition — seats_decompose
text: sarima SARIMA model (see rjd3toolkit::sarima_model()). seas.tolerance numeric: seasonal tolerance (epsphi). tolerance (measured degrees) allocate AR non-real roots seasonal component (modulus inverse complex AR root greater trend boundary frequency root differs one seasonal frequencies less Seasonal tolerance) transitory component (otherwise). Possible values [0,10]. Default value 2. trend.boundary numeric: trend boundary (rmod). boundary beyond AR root integrated trend component. modulus inverse real root greater trend boundary, AR root integrated trend component. value, root integrated transitory component. Possible values [0,1]. Default=0.5. seas.boundary numeric: seasonal boundary (sbound). boundary beyond real negative AR root integrated seasonal component. modulus inverse negative real root greater (equal) Seasonal boundary, AR root integrated seasonal component. Otherwise root integrated trend transitory component. Possible values [0,1]. Default=0.8. seas.boundary.unique numeric: seasonal boundary (unique),(sboundatpi). boundary beyond negative AR root integrated seasonal component, root unique seasonal root.  modulus inverse negative real root greater (equal) Seasonal boundary, AR root integrated seasonal component. Otherwise root integrated trend transitory component. Possible values [0,1]. Default=0.8. approximation character: approximation mode. ARIMA model estimated TRAMO accept admissible decomposition, SEATS: "None" - performs approximation; "Legacy" - replaces model decomposable one; "Noisy" - estimates new model adding white noise non-admissible model estimated TRAMO. Default="Legacy".

title: Set Seats Specification — set_seats
text: Function allowing customize parameters decomposition part (Seats) Tramo-Seats seasonal adjustment process. (Seats Arima Model Based decomposition algorithm working conjunction Tramo.)

title: Set Seats Specification — set_seats
code: set_seats(   x,   approximation = c(NA, "None", "Legacy", "Noisy"),   trend.boundary = NA,   seas.boundary = NA,   seas.boundary.unique = NA,   seas.tolerance = NA,   ma.boundary = NA,   fcasts = NA,   bcasts = NA,   algorithm = c(NA, "Burman", "KalmanSmoother"),   bias = NA )

title: Set Seats Specification — set_seats
text: x specification modified, object class "JD3_TRAMOSEATS_SPEC", generated tramoseats_spec() function approximation character: approximation mode. ARIMA model estimated TRAMO accept admissible decomposition, SEATS: "None" - performs approximation; "Legacy" - replaces model decomposable one; "Noisy" - estimates new model adding white noise non-admissible model estimated TRAMO. Default="Legacy". trend.boundary numeric: trend boundary (rmod). boundary beyond AR root integrated trend component. modulus inverse real root greater trend boundary, AR root integrated trend component. value, root integrated transitory component. Possible values [0,1]. Default=0.5. seas.boundary numeric: seasonal boundary (sbound). boundary beyond real negative AR root integrated seasonal component. modulus inverse negative real root greater (equal) Seasonal boundary, AR root integrated seasonal component. Otherwise root integrated trend transitory component. Possible values [0,1]. Default=0.8. seas.boundary.unique numeric: seasonal boundary (unique),(sboundatpi). boundary beyond negative AR root integrated seasonal component, root unique seasonal root.  modulus inverse negative real root greater (equal) Seasonal boundary, AR root integrated seasonal component. Otherwise root integrated trend transitory component. Possible values [0,1]. Default=0.8. seas.tolerance numeric: seasonal tolerance (epsphi). tolerance (measured degrees) allocate AR non-real roots seasonal component (modulus inverse complex AR root greater trend boundary frequency root differs one seasonal frequencies less Seasonal tolerance) transitory component (otherwise). Possible values [0,10]. Default value 2. ma.boundary numeric: MA unit root boundary. modulus estimated MA root falls range [xl, 1], set xl. Possible values [0.9,1]. Default=0.95. bcasts, fcasts numeric: number backasts (bcasts) forecasts (fcasts) used decomposition periods (positive values) years (negative values).Default bcasts=0. Default fcasts=0. algorithm character: estimation method unobserved components. choice can made : "Burman": default value. May result significant underestimation components' standard deviation, may become numerically unstable roots MA polynomial near 1; "KalmanSmoother": disturbed (quasi-) unit roots MA; bias TODO.

title: Set Seats Specification — set_seats
text: object class  "JD3_TRAMOSEATS_SPEC".

title: Set Seats Specification — set_seats
text: information examples related 'JDemetra+' features online documentation: https://jdemetra-new-documentation.netlify.app/

title: Set Seats Specification — set_seats
code: init_spec<-tramoseats_spec("rsafull") new_spec<- set_seats(init_spec,                     approximation = "Legacy",                     trend.boundary = 0.8,                     seas.boundary = 0.5,                     fcasts = -3,                     algorithm = "KalmanSmoother",                     bias = TRUE) y <- rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.09.10.M sa<- tramoseats(y,spec=new_spec)

what: TERROR Quality Control of Outliers — terror
title: TERROR Quality Control of Outliers — terror
text: TRAMO ERRORs (TERROR) controls quality data checking outliers end series

title: TERROR Quality Control of Outliers — terror
code: terror(   ts,   spec = c("trfull", "tr0", "tr1", "tr2", "tr3", "tr4", "tr5"),   nback = 1,   context = NULL )

title: TERROR Quality Control of Outliers — terror
text: ts univariate time series. spec model specification. Can either name predefined specification user-defined specification. nback number last observations considered quality check. context dictionnary variables.

title: TERROR Quality Control of Outliers — terror
text: mts object 7 variables: actual actual data end series. forecast forecast actual data end series. error absolute errors (= observed - forecasts). rel.error relative errors ("scores") : ratios forecast errors standard deviation forecasts last observations (positive values mean -estimation). raw transformed series. especially, chosen model implies log-transformation, values obtained log-transformation. transformations, leap year corrections length-periods corrections may also used. fraw forecast transformed series. efraw absolute errors transformed series.

title: TERROR Quality Control of Outliers — terror

title: TRAMO model, pre-adjustment in TRAMO-SEATS — tramo
text: tramo() function returns list results ("JD3_regarima_rslts" object), estimation specification result specification, tramo_fast() faster function returns results.

title: TRAMO model, pre-adjustment in TRAMO-SEATS — tramo
code: library("rjd3toolkit") #>  #> Attaching package: ‘rjd3toolkit’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     aggregate, mad y = rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.09.10.M sp = tramo_spec("trfull") sp = add_outlier(sp,                  type = c("AO"), c("2015-01-01", "2010-01-01")) tramo_fast(y, spec = sp) #> Log-transformation: yes  #> SARIMA model:  (2,1,2) (0,1,1) #>  #> Coefficients #>           Estimate Std. Error T-stat #> phi(1)    -0.09251    0.39861 -0.232 #> phi(2)     0.12325    0.08546  1.442 #> theta(1)  -1.02295    0.40059 -2.554 #> theta(2)   0.24537    0.31899  0.769 #> btheta(1) -0.43575    0.06277 -6.942 #>  #> Regression model: #>                   Estimate Std. Error T-stat #> monday          -1.131e-02  3.604e-03 -3.137 #> tuesday          5.831e-03  3.623e-03  1.609 #> wednesday       -8.502e-05  3.605e-03 -0.024 #> thursday         1.293e-02  3.665e-03  3.529 #> friday          -2.076e-03  3.646e-03 -0.569 #> saturday         1.535e-02  3.635e-03  4.224 #> lp               3.881e-02  9.934e-03  3.907 #> easter           5.207e-02  7.566e-03  6.882 #> AO (2010-01-01)  3.674e-02  2.922e-02  1.258 #> AO (2015-01-01) -9.888e-03  2.935e-02 -0.337 #> AO (2000-06-01)  1.736e-01  2.928e-02  5.928 #> AO (2000-07-01) -1.831e-01  2.918e-02 -6.273 #> Number of observations:  425  #> Number of effective observations:  412  #> Number of parameters:  18  #>  #> Loglikelihood:  787.6949  #> Adjusted loglikelihood:  -2079.932  #>  #> Standard error of the regression (ML estimate):  0.03560084  #> AIC:  4195.864  #> AICC:  4197.604  #> BIC:  4268.242  #>  sp = set_transform(   set_tradingdays(     set_easter(sp, enabled = FALSE),     option = "workingdays"   ),   fun = "None" ) tramo_fast(y, spec = sp) #> Log-transformation: no  #> SARIMA model:  (0,1,1) (0,1,1) #>  #> Coefficients #>           Estimate Std. Error T-stat #> theta(1)  -0.82355    0.02896 -28.43 #> btheta(1) -0.26081    0.04903  -5.32 #>  #> Regression model: #>                  Estimate Std. Error T-stat #> monday           -11.7873     3.8750 -3.042 #> tuesday            0.2507     3.8786  0.065 #> wednesday          3.0039     3.8746  0.775 #> thursday          12.8309     3.9423  3.255 #> friday            -5.4519     3.9132 -1.393 #> saturday          17.2998     3.9274  4.405 #> lp                33.6083    11.2479  2.988 #> AO (2010-01-01)   40.5331    33.7485  1.201 #> AO (2015-01-01)  -10.7096    33.7815 -0.317 #> AO (2000-06-01)  192.7411    33.9640  5.675 #> AO (2000-07-01) -200.7316    33.7986 -5.939 #> AO (2005-04-01) -177.1356    33.7257 -5.252 #> Number of observations:  425  #> Number of effective observations:  412  #> Number of parameters:  15  #>  #> Loglikelihood:  -2139.74  #> Standard error of the regression (ML estimate):  43.47307  #> AIC:  4309.481  #> AICC:  4310.693  #> BIC:  4369.796  #>  sp = set_outlier(sp, outliers.type = c("AO")) tramo_fast(y, spec = sp) #> Log-transformation: no  #> SARIMA model:  (0,1,1) (0,1,1) #>  #> Coefficients #>           Estimate Std. Error T-stat #> theta(1)  -0.82355    0.02896 -28.43 #> btheta(1) -0.26081    0.04903  -5.32 #>  #> Regression model: #>                  Estimate Std. Error T-stat #> monday           -11.7873     3.8750 -3.042 #> tuesday            0.2507     3.8786  0.065 #> wednesday          3.0039     3.8746  0.775 #> thursday          12.8309     3.9423  3.255 #> friday            -5.4519     3.9132 -1.393 #> saturday          17.2998     3.9274  4.405 #> lp                33.6083    11.2479  2.988 #> AO (2010-01-01)   40.5331    33.7485  1.201 #> AO (2015-01-01)  -10.7096    33.7815 -0.317 #> AO (2000-06-01)  192.7411    33.9640  5.675 #> AO (2000-07-01) -200.7316    33.7986 -5.939 #> AO (2005-04-01) -177.1356    33.7257 -5.252 #> Number of observations:  425  #> Number of effective observations:  412  #> Number of parameters:  15  #>  #> Loglikelihood:  -2139.74  #> Standard error of the regression (ML estimate):  43.47307  #> AIC:  4309.481  #> AICC:  4310.693  #> BIC:  4369.796  #>

title: Forecasts with TRAMO — tramo_forecast
text: Forecasts TRAMO

title: Forecasts with TRAMO — tramo_forecast
code: tramo_forecast(   ts,   spec = c("trfull", "tr0", "tr1", "tr2", "tr3", "tr4", "tr5"),   nf = -1,   context = NULL )

title: Forecasts with TRAMO — tramo_forecast
text: ts univariate time series. spec model specification. Can either name predefined specification user-defined specification. nf forecasting horizon (numeric). forecast length periods (positive values) years (negative values). default, program generates one-year forecast (nf = -1). context dictionnary variables.

title: Forecasts with TRAMO — tramo_forecast
text: mts object 7 variables: forecast forecast actual data end series. error standard deviation forecast. fraw forecast transformed series. efraw standard deviation forecast transformed series.

what: Outlier Detection with a Tramo Model — tramo_outliers
title: Outlier Detection with a Tramo Model — tramo_outliers
text: Tramo particular regarima model estimation algorithm, mainly used linearized series performing decomposition Seats

title: Outlier Detection with a Tramo Model — tramo_outliers
code: tramo_outliers(   y,   order = c(0L, 1L, 1L),   seasonal = c(0L, 1L, 1L),   mean = FALSE,   X = NULL,   X.td = NULL,   ao = TRUE,   ls = TRUE,   tc = FALSE,   so = FALSE,   cv = 0,   ml = FALSE,   clean = FALSE )

title: Outlier Detection with a Tramo Model — tramo_outliers
text: y dependent variable (ts object). order, seasonal orders ARIMA model. mean Boolean include mean. X user defined regressors (calendar). X.td calendar regressors. ao, ls, , tc Boolean indicate type outliers detected. cv numeric. entered critical value outliers' detection procedure. equal 0 critical value outliers' detection procedure automatically determined number observations. ml Use maximum likelihood (otherwise approximation means Hannan-Rissanen). clean Clean missing values beginning/end series. Regression variables automatically resized, need .

title: Outlier Detection with a Tramo Model — tramo_outliers
text: "JD3_REGARIMA_OUTLIERS" object.

title: Outlier Detection with a Tramo Model — tramo_outliers

code: tramoseats(   ts,   spec = c("rsafull", "rsa0", "rsa1", "rsa2", "rsa3", "rsa4", "rsa5"),   context = NULL,   userdefined = NULL )  tramoseats_fast(   ts,   spec = c("rsafull", "rsa0", "rsa1", "rsa2", "rsa3", "rsa4", "rsa5"),   context = NULL,   userdefined = NULL )  jtramoseats(   ts,   spec = c("rsafull", "rsa0", "rsa1", "rsa2", "rsa3", "rsa4", "rsa5"),   context = NULL,   userdefined = NULL )

title: Seasonal Adjustment with  TRAMO-SEATS — tramoseats
text: ts univariate time series. spec model specification. Can either name predefined specification user-defined specification. context dictionnary variables. userdefined vector containing additional output variables (see tramoseats_dictionary()).

title: Seasonal Adjustment with  TRAMO-SEATS — tramoseats
text: tramoseats() function returns list results, estimation specification result specification, tramoseats_fast() faster function returns results. jtramoseats() functions results java object custom outputs packages (use rjd3toolkit::dictionary() get list variables rjd3toolkit::result() get specific variable).

title: TRAMO-SEATS Dictionary — tramoseats_dictionary
text: TRAMO-SEATS Dictionary

title: TRAMO-SEATS Dictionary — tramoseats_dictionary
code: tramoseats_dictionary()

title: TRAMO-SEATS Dictionary — tramoseats_dictionary
text: vector containing names available output objects (series, diagnostics, parameters).

title: Revisions History — tramoseats_revisions
text: Compute revisions history

title: Revisions History — tramoseats_revisions
code: tramoseats_revisions(   ts,   spec,   data_ids = NULL,   ts_ids = NULL,   cmp_ids = NULL,   context = NULL )

title: Revisions History — tramoseats_revisions
text: ts time series used estimation. spec specification used. data_ids list list specify statistics export. sub-list must contain two elements: start (first date compute history, format "YYYY-MM-DD") id (name statistics, see tramoseats_dictionary()). See example. ts_ids list list specify specific date component whose history studied. sub-list must contain three elements: start (first date compute history, format "YYYY-MM-DD"), period (date studied) id (name component, see tramoseats_dictionary()). See example. cmp_ids list list specify component whose history studied. sub-list must contain three elements: start (first date compute history, format "YYYY-MM-DD"), end (last date compute history, format "YYYY-MM-DD") id (name component, see tramoseats_dictionary()). many series periods start end exported. See example. context context specification.

title: Revisions History — tramoseats_revisions
code: s <- rjd3toolkit::ABS$X0.2.09.10.M sa_mod <- tramoseats(s) data_ids <- list(   # Get the coefficient of the trading-day coefficient from 2005-jan   list(start = "2005-01-01", id = "regression.td(1)"),   # Get the ljung-box statistics on residuals from 2010-jan   list(start = "2010-01-01", id = "residuals.lb")) ts_ids <- list(   # Get the SA component estimates of 2010-jan from 2010-jan   list(period = "2010-01-01", start = "2010-01-01", id = "sa"),   # Get the irregular component estimates of 2010-jan from 2015-jan   list(period = "2010-01-01", start = "2015-01-01", id = "i")) cmp_ids <- list(   # Get the SA component estimates (full time series) 2010-jan to 2020-jan   list(start = "2010-01-01", end = "2020-01-01", id = "sa"),   # Get the trend component estimates (full time series)  2010-jan to 2020-jan   list(start = "2010-01-01", end = "2020-01-01", id = "t")) rh <- tramoseats_revisions(s, sa_mod$result_spec, data_ids, ts_ids, cmp_ids)

title: TRAMO/TRAMO-SEATS Default Specification — tramoseats_spec
text: Set functions(tramoseats_spec(),tramo_spec()) create default specifications associated TRAMO-SEATS seasonal adjustment method. Specification creation can restricted tramo part tramo_spec() function.

title: TRAMO/TRAMO-SEATS Default Specification — tramoseats_spec
code: tramo_spec(name = c("trfull", "tr0", "tr1", "tr2", "tr3", "tr4", "tr5"))  tramoseats_spec(   name = c("rsafull", "rsa0", "rsa1", "rsa2", "rsa3", "rsa4", "rsa5") )

title: TRAMO/TRAMO-SEATS Default Specification — tramoseats_spec
text: name name predefined specification.

title: TRAMO/TRAMO-SEATS Default Specification — tramoseats_spec
text: object class "JD3_TRAMOSEATS_SPEC" (tramoseats_spec()) "JD3_TRAMO_SPEC" (tramo_spec()).

title: TRAMO/TRAMO-SEATS Default Specification — tramoseats_spec
text: Without argument tramo_spec() yields TR5 specification without argument tramoseats_spec()  yields RSA5 specification available predefined 'JDemetra+' model specifications described table :

title: TRAMO/TRAMO-SEATS Default Specification — tramoseats_spec
code: init_spec <- tramoseats_spec() init_spec <- tramo_spec() init_spec <- tramoseats_spec("rsa3") init_spec <- tramo_spec("tr3")

what: Display list of all available output objects (series, parameters, diagnostics) — userdefined_variables_tramoseats
